verses.verse: And in the second <S%H8147><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of the reign <S%H4438><s%> of Nebuchadnezzar <S%H5019><s%>, Nebuchadnezzar <S%H5019><s%> dreamed <S%H2492><s%> dreams <S%H2472><s%>; and his spirit <S%H7307><s%> was troubled <S%H6470><s%>, and his sleep <S%H8142><s%> went from him <S%H1961><s%>.

Then the king <S%H4428><s%> commanded <S%H559><s%> to call <S%H7121><s%> the magicians <S%H2748><s%>, and the enchanters <S%H825><s%>, and the sorcerers <S%H3784><s%>, and the Chaldeans <S%H3778><s%>, to tell <S%H5046><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> his dreams <S%H2472><s%>. So they came <S%H935><s%> in and stood <S%H5975><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%>.

And the king <S%H4428><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H2492><s%>, I have dreamed a dream <S%H2472><s%>, and my spirit <S%H7307><s%> is troubled <S%H6470><s%> to know <S%H3045><s%> the dream <S%H2472><s%>.

Then spake <S%H1696><s%> the Chaldeans <S%H3778><s%> to the king <S%H4428><s%> in the Syrian language <S%H762><s%>, O king <S%H4430><s%>, live <S%H2418><s%> for ever <S%H5957><s%>: tell <S%H560><s%> thy servants <S%H5649><s%> the dream <S%H2493><s%>, and we will show <S%H2324><s%> the interpretation <S%H6591><s%>.

The king <S%H4430><s%> answered <S%H6032><s%> and said <S%H560><s%> to the Chaldeans <S%H3779><s%>, The thing <S%H4406><s%> is gone <S%H230><s%> from me <S%H4481><s%>: if <S%H2006><s%> ye make not <S%H3809><s%> known <S%H3046><s%> unto me the dream <S%H2493><s%> and the interpretation <S%H6591><s%> thereof <S%H5648><s%>, ye shall be cut in pieces <S%H1917><s%>, and your houses <S%H1005><s%> shall be made <S%H7761><s%> a dunghill <S%H5122><s%>.

But if <S%H2006><s%> ye show <S%H2324><s%> the dream <S%H2493><s%> and the interpretation <S%H6591><s%> thereof <S%H6902><s%>, ye shall receive of <S%H4481><s%> me <S%H6925><s%> gifts <S%H4978><s%> and rewards <S%H5023><s%> and great <S%H7690><s%> honor <S%H3367><s%>: therefore <S%H3861><s%> show <S%H2324><s%> me the dream <S%H2493><s%> and the interpretation thereof <S%H6591><s%>.

They answered <S%H6032><s%> the second <S%H8579><s%> time and said <S%H560><s%>, Let the king <S%H4430><s%> tell <S%H560><s%> his servants <S%H5649><s%> the dream <S%H2493><s%>, and we will show <S%H2324><s%> the interpretation <S%H6591><s%>.

The king <S%H4430><s%> answered <S%H6032><s%> and said <S%H560><s%>, I <S%H576><s%> know <S%H3046><s%> of <S%H4481><s%> a certainty <S%H3330><s%> that ye <S%H608><s%> would gain <S%H2084><s%> time <S%H5732><s%>, because <S%H6903><s%> ye see <S%H2370><s%> the thing <S%H4406><s%> is gone <S%H230><s%> from me <S%H4481><s%>.

But if <S%H2006><s%> ye make not <S%H3809><s%> known <S%H3046><s%> unto me the dream <S%H2493><s%>, there is but one <S%H1932><s%> law <S%H1882><s%> for you <S%H2164><s%>; for ye have prepared lying <S%H3538><s%> and corrupt <S%H7844><s%> words <S%H4406><s%> to speak <S%H560><s%> before <S%H6925><s%> me <S%H5705><s%>, till the time <S%H5732><s%> be changed <S%H8133><s%>: therefore <S%H3861><s%> tell <S%H560><s%> me the dream <S%H2493><s%>, and I shall know <S%H3046><s%> that <S%H1768><s%> ye can show <S%H2324><s%> me the interpretation thereof <S%H6591><s%>.

The Chaldeans <S%H3779><s%> answered <S%H6032><s%> before <S%H6925><s%> the king <S%H4430><s%>, and said <S%H560><s%>, There is <S%H383><s%> not <S%H3809><s%> a man <S%H606><s%> upon <S%H5922><s%> the earth <S%H3007><s%> that can <S%H3202><s%> show <S%H2324><s%> the king <S%H4430><s%>'s matter <S%H4406><s%>, forasmuch <S%H6903><s%> as no <S%H3809><s%> king <S%H4430><s%>, lord <S%H7229><s%>, or ruler <S%H7990><s%>, hath asked <S%H7593><s%> such <S%H1836><s%> a thing <S%H4406><s%> of any <S%H3606><s%> magician <S%H2749><s%>, or enchanter <S%H826><s%>, or Chaldean <S%H3779><s%>.

And it is a rare <S%H3358><s%> thing <S%H4406><s%> that the king <S%H4430><s%> requireth <S%H7593><s%>, and there is <S%H383><s%> no <S%H3809><s%> other <S%H321><s%> that can show <S%H2324><s%> it before <S%H6925><s%> the king <S%H4430><s%>, except <S%H3861><s%> the gods <S%H426><s%>, whose dwelling <S%H4070><s%> is <S%H383><s%> not <S%H3809><s%> with <S%H5974><s%> flesh <S%H1321><s%>.

For <S%H6903><s%> this <S%H1836><s%> cause <S%H3606><s%> the king <S%H4430><s%> was angry <S%H1149><s%> and very <S%H7690><s%> furious <S%H7108><s%>, and commanded <S%H560><s%> to destroy <S%H7><s%> all <S%H3606><s%> the wise <S%H2445><s%> men of Babylon <S%H895><s%>.

So the decree <S%H1882><s%> went forth <S%H5312><s%>, and the wise <S%H2445><s%> men were to be slain <S%H6992><s%>; and they sought <S%H1156><s%> Daniel <S%H1841><s%> and his companions <S%H2269><s%> to be slain <S%H6992><s%>.

Then <S%H116><s%> Daniel <S%H1841><s%> returned answer <S%H8421><s%> with counsel <S%H5843><s%> and prudence <S%H2942><s%> to Arioch <S%H746><s%> the captain <S%H7229><s%> of <S%H1768><s%> the king <S%H4430><s%>'s guard <S%H2877><s%>, who was gone forth <S%H5312><s%> to slay <S%H6992><s%> the wise <S%H2445><s%> men of Babylon <S%H895><s%>;

he answered <S%H6032><s%> and said <S%H560><s%> to Arioch <S%H746><s%> the king <S%H4430><s%>'s captain <S%H7990><s%>, Wherefore <S%H4101><s%> is the decree <S%H1882><s%> so urgent <S%H2685><s%> from <S%H4481><s%> the king <S%H4430><s%>? Then <S%H116><s%> Arioch <S%H746><s%> made the thing <S%H4406><s%> known <S%H3046><s%> to Daniel <S%H1841><s%>.

And Daniel <S%H1841><s%> went in <S%H5954><s%>, and desired <S%H1156><s%> of <S%H4481><s%> the king <S%H4430><s%> that he would appoint <S%H5415><s%> him a time <S%H2166><s%>, and he would show <S%H2324><s%> the king <S%H4430><s%> the interpretation <S%H6591><s%>.

Then <S%H116><s%> Daniel <S%H1841><s%> went <S%H236><s%> to his house <S%H1005><s%>, and made the thing <S%H4406><s%> known <S%H3046><s%> to Hananiah <S%H2608><s%>, Mishael <S%H4333><s%>, and Azariah <S%H5839><s%>, his companions <S%H2269><s%>:

that they would desire <S%H1156><s%> mercies <S%H7359><s%> of <S%H4481><s%> the God <S%H426><s%> of heaven <S%H8065><s%> concerning <S%H5922><s%> this <S%H1836><s%> secret <S%H7328><s%>; that Daniel <S%H1841><s%> and his companions <S%H2269><s%> should not <S%H3809><s%> perish <S%H7><s%> with <S%H5974><s%> the rest <S%H7606><s%> of the wise <S%H2445><s%> men of Babylon <S%H895><s%>.

Then <S%H116><s%> was the secret <S%H7328><s%> revealed <S%H1541><s%> unto Daniel <S%H1841><s%> in a vision <S%H2376><s%> of the night <S%H3916><s%>. Then <S%H116><s%> Daniel <S%H1841><s%> blessed <S%H1289><s%> the God <S%H426><s%> of heaven <S%H8065><s%>.

340 <S%H1841><s%> answered <S%H6032><s%> and said <S%H560><s%>, Blessed <S%H1289><s%> be <S%H1934><s%> the name <S%H8036><s%> of God <S%H426><s%> for <S%H4481><s%> ever <S%H5957><s%> and ever <S%H5705><s%>; for wisdom <S%H2452><s%> and might <S%H1370><s%> are his <S%H1932><s%>.

And he changeth <S%H8133><s%> the times <S%H5732><s%> and the seasons <S%H2166><s%>; he removeth <S%H5709><s%> kings <S%H4430><s%>, and setteth up <S%H6966><s%> kings <S%H4430><s%>; he giveth <S%H3052><s%> wisdom <S%H2452><s%> unto the wise <S%H2445><s%>, and knowledge <S%H4486><s%> to them that have <S%H3046><s%> understanding <S%H999><s%>;

he revealeth <S%H1541><s%> the deep <S%H5994><s%> and secret things <S%H5642><s%>; he knoweth <S%H3046><s%> what <S%H4101><s%> is in the darkness <S%H2816><s%>, and the light <S%H5094><s%> dwelleth <S%H8271><s%> with him <S%H5974><s%>.

I <S%H576><s%> thank <S%H3029><s%> thee <S%H7624><s%>, and praise thee <S%H426><s%>, O thou God of my fathers <S%H2><s%>, who hast given <S%H3052><s%> me wisdom <S%H2452><s%> and might <S%H1370><s%>, and hast now <S%H3705><s%> made known <S%H3046><s%> unto me what we desired <S%H1156><s%> of thee <S%H4481><s%>; for thou hast made known <S%H3046><s%> unto us the king <S%H4430><s%>'s matter <S%H4406><s%>.

Therefore <S%H6903><s%> Daniel <S%H1841><s%> went in <S%H5954><s%> unto <S%H5922><s%> Arioch <S%H746><s%>, whom the king <S%H4430><s%> had appointed <S%H4483><s%> to destroy <S%H7><s%> the wise <S%H2445><s%> men of Babylon <S%H895><s%>; he went <S%H236><s%> and said <S%H560><s%> thus <S%H3652><s%> unto him <S%H7><s%>: Destroy not <S%H409><s%> the wise <S%H2445><s%> men of Babylon <S%H895><s%>; bring me in <S%H5954><s%> before <S%H6925><s%> the king <S%H4430><s%>, and I will show <S%H2324><s%> unto the king <S%H4430><s%> the interpretation <S%H6591><s%>.

Then <S%H116><s%> Arioch <S%H746><s%> brought in <S%H5954><s%> Daniel <S%H1841><s%> before <S%H6925><s%> the king <S%H4430><s%> in haste <S%H927><s%>, and said <S%H560><s%> thus <S%H3652><s%> unto him <S%H7912><s%>, I have found a man <S%H1400><s%> of the children of the captivity <S%H1123><s%> of <S%H4481><s%> Judah <S%H3061><s%>, that will make known <S%H3046><s%> unto the king <S%H4430><s%> the interpretation <S%H6591><s%>.

The king <S%H4430><s%> answered <S%H6032><s%> and said <S%H560><s%> to Daniel <S%H1841><s%>, whose name <S%H8036><s%> was Belteshazzar <S%H1096><s%>, Art <S%H383><s%> thou able <S%H3546><s%> to make known <S%H3046><s%> unto me the dream <S%H2493><s%> which I have seen <S%H2370><s%>, and the interpretation thereof <S%H6591><s%>?

340 <S%H1841><s%> answered <S%H6032><s%> before <S%H6925><s%> the king <S%H4430><s%>, and said <S%H560><s%>, The secret <S%H7328><s%> which the king <S%H4430><s%> hath demanded <S%H7593><s%> can neither <S%H3202><s%> wise <S%H2445><s%> men <S%H826><s%>, enchanters, magicians <S%H2749><s%>, nor soothsayers <S%H1505><s%>, show <S%H2324><s%> unto the king <S%H4430><s%>;

but <S%H1297><s%> there is <S%H383><s%> a God <S%H426><s%> in heaven <S%H8065><s%> that revealeth <S%H1541><s%> secrets <S%H7328><s%>, and he hath made known <S%H3046><s%> to the king <S%H4430><s%> Nebuchadnezzar <S%H5020><s%> what <S%H4101><s%> shall be <S%H1934><s%> in the latter <S%H320><s%> days <S%H3118><s%>. Thy dream <S%H2493><s%>, and the visions <S%H2376><s%> of thy head <S%H7217><s%> upon <S%H5922><s%> thy bed <S%H4903><s%>, are these <S%H1836><s%>:

as for thee <S%H607><s%>, O king <S%H4430><s%>, thy thoughts <S%H7476><s%> came <S%H5559><s%> into thy mind upon <S%H5922><s%> thy bed <S%H4903><s%>, what <S%H4101><s%> should come to pass <S%H1934><s%> hereafter <S%H311><s%>; and he that revealeth <S%H1541><s%> secrets <S%H7328><s%> hath made known <S%H3046><s%> to thee what <S%H4101><s%> shall come to pass <S%H1934><s%>.

But as for me <S%H576><s%>, this <S%H1836><s%> secret <S%H7328><s%> is not <S%H3809><s%> revealed <S%H1541><s%> to me <S%H576><s%> for any wisdom <S%H2452><s%> that I have <S%H383><s%> more than <S%H4481><s%> any <S%H3606><s%> living <S%H2417><s%>, but <S%H3861><s%> to the intent that <S%H5922><s%> the interpretation <S%H6591><s%> may be made known <S%H3046><s%> to the king <S%H4430><s%>, and that thou mayest know <S%H3046><s%> the thoughts <S%H7476><s%> of thy heart <S%H3825><s%>.

Thou <S%H607><s%>, O king <S%H4430><s%>, sawest <S%H1934><s%>, and <S%H431><s%>, behold, a great <S%H2298><s%> image <S%H6755><s%>. This <S%H1797><s%> image <S%H6755><s%>, which was mighty <S%H7229><s%>, and whose brightness <S%H2122><s%> was excellent <S%H3493><s%>, stood <S%H6966><s%> before <S%H6903><s%> thee <S%H7299><s%>; and the aspect thereof was terrible <S%H1763><s%>.

As for this image <S%H6755><s%>, its head <S%H7217><s%> was of fine <S%H2869><s%> gold <S%H1722><s%>, its breast <S%H2306><s%> and its arms <S%H1872><s%> of silver <S%H3702><s%>, its belly <S%H4577><s%> and its thighs <S%H3410><s%> of brass <S%H5174><s%>,
its legs <S%H8243><s%> of iron <S%H6523><s%>, its feet <S%H7271><s%> part <S%H4481><s%> of iron <S%H6523><s%>, and part <S%H4481><s%> of clay <S%H2635><s%>.

Thou sawest <S%H2370><s%> till <S%H5705><s%> that a stone <S%H69><s%> was cut out <S%H1505><s%> without <S%H3809><s%> hands <S%H3028><s%>, which smote <S%H4223><s%> the image <S%H6755><s%> upon <S%H5922><s%> its feet <S%H7271><s%> that were of iron <S%H6523><s%> and clay <S%H2635><s%>, and brake <S%H1855><s%> them <S%H1994><s%> in pieces <S%H1855><s%>.

Then <S%H116><s%> was the iron <S%H6523><s%>, the clay <S%H2635><s%>, the brass <S%H5174><s%>, the silver <S%H3702><s%>, and the gold <S%H1722><s%>, broken in pieces <S%H1855><s%> together <S%H2298><s%>, and became <S%H1934><s%> like the chaff <S%H5784><s%> of <S%H4481><s%> the summer <S%H7007><s%> threshing-floors <S%H147><s%>; and the wind <S%H7308><s%> carried <S%H5376><s%> them <S%H1994><s%> away <S%H5376><s%>, so that <S%H3606><s%> no <S%H3809><s%> place <S%H870><s%> was found <S%H7912><s%> for them <S%H69><s%>: and the stone that smote <S%H4223><s%> the image <S%H6755><s%> became <S%H1934><s%> a great <S%H7229><s%> mountain <S%H2906><s%>, and filled <S%H4391><s%> the whole <S%H3606><s%> earth <S%H772><s%>.
This <S%H1836><s%> is the dream <S%H2493><s%>; and we will tell <S%H560><s%> the interpretation <S%H6591><s%> thereof before <S%H6925><s%> the king <S%H4430><s%>.

Thou <S%H607><s%>, O king <S%H4430><s%>, art king <S%H4430><s%> of kings <S%H4430><s%>, unto whom the God <S%H426><s%> of heaven <S%H8065><s%> hath given <S%H3052><s%> the kingdom <S%H4437><s%>, the power <S%H2632><s%>, and the strength <S%H8632><s%>, and the glory <S%H3367><s%>;

and wheresoever <S%H3606><s%> the children <S%H1123><s%> of men <S%H606><s%> dwell <S%H1753><s%>, the beasts <S%H2423><s%> of the field <S%H1251><s%> and the birds <S%H5776><s%> of the heavens <S%H8065><s%> hath he given <S%H3052><s%> into thy hand <S%H3028><s%>, and hath made thee to rule <S%H7981><s%> over them all <S%H3606><s%>: thou <S%H607><s%> art the head <S%H7217><s%> of gold <S%H1722><s%>.

And after <S%H870><s%> thee shall arise <S%H6966><s%> another <S%H317><s%> kingdom <S%H4437><s%> inferior <S%H772><s%> to thee <S%H4481><s%>; and another <S%H317><s%> third <S%H8523><s%> kingdom <S%H4437><s%> of brass <S%H5174><s%>, which shall bear rule <S%H7981><s%> over all <S%H3606><s%> the earth <S%H772><s%>.

And the fourth <S%H7244><s%> kingdom <S%H4437><s%> shall be <S%H1934><s%> strong <S%H8624><s%> as iron <S%H6523><s%>, forasmuch as iron <S%H6523><s%> breaketh in pieces <S%H1855><s%> and subdueth <S%H2827><s%> all <S%H3606><s%> things <S%H6903><s%>; and as iron <S%H6523><s%> that crusheth <S%H7490><s%> all <S%H3606><s%> these <S%H459><s%>, shall it break in pieces <S%H1855><s%> and crush <S%H7490><s%>.

And whereas thou sawest <S%H2370><s%> the feet <S%H7271><s%> and toes <S%H677><s%>, part <S%H4481><s%> of potters <S%H6353><s%>' clay <S%H2635><s%>, and part <S%H4481><s%> of iron <S%H6523><s%>, it shall be <S%H1934><s%> a divided <S%H6386><s%> kingdom <S%H4437><s%>; but <S%H4481><s%> there shall be <S%H1934><s%> in it of <S%H4481><s%> the strength <S%H5326><s%> of the iron <S%H6523><s%>, forasmuch as <S%H3606><s%> thou sawest <S%H2370><s%> the iron <S%H6523><s%> mixed <S%H6151><s%> with miry <S%H2917><s%> clay <S%H2635><s%>.

And as the toes <S%H677><s%> of the feet <S%H7271><s%> were part <S%H4481><s%> of iron <S%H6523><s%>, and part <S%H4481><s%> of clay <S%H2635><s%>, so the kingdom <S%H4437><s%> shall be <S%H1934><s%> partly <S%H4481><s%> strong <S%H8624><s%>, and partly <S%H4481><s%> broken <S%H8406><s%>.

And whereas <S%H1768><s%> thou sawest <S%H2370><s%> the iron <S%H6523><s%> mixed <S%H6151><s%> with miry <S%H2917><s%> clay <S%H2635><s%>, they shall mingle themselves <S%H1934><s%> with the seed <S%H2234><s%> of men <S%H606><s%>; but they shall <S%H1934><s%> not <S%H3809><s%> cleave <S%H1693><s%> one <S%H1836><s%> to <S%H5974><s%> another <S%H1836><s%>, even <S%H1888><s%> as iron <S%H6523><s%> doth not <S%H3809><s%> mingle <S%H6151><s%> with clay <S%H2635><s%>.

And in the days <S%H3118><s%> of those <S%H581><s%> kings <S%H4430><s%> shall the God <S%H426><s%> of heaven <S%H8065><s%> set up <S%H6966><s%> a kingdom <S%H4437><s%> which shall never <S%H5957><s%> be destroyed <S%H2255><s%>, nor <S%H3809><s%> shall the sovereignty <S%H4437><s%> thereof be left <S%H7662><s%> to another <S%H321><s%> people <S%H5972><s%>; but it shall break in pieces <S%H1855><s%> and consume <S%H5487><s%> all <S%H3606><s%> these <S%H459><s%> kingdoms <S%H4437><s%>, and it <S%H1932><s%> shall stand <S%H6966><s%> for ever <S%H5957><s%>.
